src:
IHSG Diprediksi Menguat Sepanjang Pekan
04 Nov 2019, 01:55 by Ardan Adhi Chandra


Foto: Rengga Sancaya

Jakarta - Indeks Harga Saham Gabungan (IHSG) diperkirakan menguat sepanjang pekan ini. IHSG diprediksi berada di level 6.099-6.178."Pekan ini kami perkirakan IHSG berpeluang konsolidasi menguat dengan support di level 6.178 sampai 6.099 dan resistance di level 6.304 sampai 6.348," kata Direktur PT Anugerah Mega Investama Hans Kwee, Senin (4/11/2019).Dari dalam negeri, Bank Indonesia (BI) memprediksi tren bunga rendah masih akan berlangsung cukup lama. Hal ini juga didukung data inflasi yang relatif rendah di mana angka inflasi pada Oktober 2019 sebesar 0,02%, lebih tinggi dibandingkan dengan bulan September 2019 yang terjadi deflasi sebesar 0,27%. "Tetapi lebih rendah di bandingkan Oktober 2018 yang terjadi inflasi sebesar 0,28%. Suku bunga rendah dalam negeri menjadi sentiemen positif bagi pasar," ujanrya.Pasar juga akan mencermati perkembangan negosiasi perang dagang China-AS. Larry Kudlow, penasehat ekonomi AS mengatakan telah terjadi kemajuan negosiasi damai perang dagang AS-China. AS ingin menandatangani kesepakatan di awal bulan November meskipun perjanjian fase I belum selesai dan beberapa masalah akan didorong ke fase kedua. Sebelumnya pejabat China pesimistis akan adanya kesepakatan dagang dalam jangka panjang. Ada laporan yang menulis China juga enggan untuk berkomitmen memenuhi tuntutan AS untuk membeli produk pertanian AS senilai US$ 50 miliar. Hal ini menjadi perhatian pasar karena akan menjadi sentimen ketidakpastian di pasar. The Fed pekan lalu melakukan pemotongan suku bunga acuannya sebesar 0,25% menjadi antara 1,50% dan 1,75%. Tetapi pernyataan The Fed bahwa pasar tenaga kerja tetap kuat, kegiatan ekonomi meningkat pada tingkat yang moderat, sementara investasi bisnis dan ekspor tetap lemah dan inflasi tetap di bawah target 2%. "Pernyataan ini dinilai sebagai indikasi Fed tidak akan agresif menurunkan suku bunga pada kuartal ke depan. Seperti prediksi kami minggu lalu bahwa pasar sudah mengetahui bahwa Fed akan menurunkan suku bunga ke tiga kalinya, tetapi pernyataan pejabat Fed terkait peluang penurunan bunga ke depannya akan mempengaruhi pergerakan pasar," katanya.Ini menjadi sentimen negative karena Fed nampaknya tidak akan agresif menurunkan bunga k edepannya. Ketidakpastian Brexit masih menjadi sentimen di pasar. Presiden Dewan Eropa Donald Tusk mengatakan Inggris dapat meninggalkan UE kapan saja sebelum 31 Januari, asalkan PM Boris Johnson dapat memperoleh persetujuan Brexit dari Parlemen. Perjalanan masih panjang karena PM Inggris mendapat penolakan dari Perlemen. Hal ini mendorong PM Inggris Boris Johnson meminta persetujuan dari Parlemen untuk menggelar pemilu dini pada 12 Desember demi memecahkan kebuntuan Brexit. Negosiasi Brexit yang tidak positif menjadi sentimen negatif di pasar. Simak Video "Dolar Tembus Rp 14.200 "[Gambas:Video 20detik](ara/ara)
text:
JCI Predicted to Strengthen Throughout the Week
Nov 04 2019, 01:55 by Ardan Adhi Chandra


Photo: Rengga Sancaya

Jakarta - The Composite Stock Price Index (CSPI) is expected to strengthen this week. JCI is predicted to be at the level of 6,099-6,178. "This week we expect the JCI to have a chance to consolidate with support at the level of 6,178 to 6,099 and resistance at the level of 6,304 to 6,348," said Director of PT Anugerah Mega Investama Hans Kwee, Monday (11/04/2019 ). From within the country, Bank Indonesia (BI) predicts the low interest rate trend will continue for a long time. This is also supported by relatively low inflation data where the inflation rate in October 2019 was 0.02%, higher than the September 2019 deflation of 0.27%. "But it is lower compared to October 2018 with inflation of 0.28%. Low domestic interest rates are a positive sentiment for the market," he said. The market will also look at the development of China-US trade war negotiations. Larry Kudlow, US economic adviser, said there had been progress in peace negotiations on the US-China trade war. The US wants to sign an agreement in early November even though the phase I agreement has not yet been completed and some issues will be pushed into the second phase. Previously Chinese officials were pessimistic about a long-term trade agreement. There are reports that China is also reluctant to commit to meeting US demands to buy US agricultural products worth US $ 50 billion. This is a concern of the market because it will be a sentiment of uncertainty in the market. The Fed last week cut its benchmark interest rate by 0.25% to between 1.50% and 1.75%. But the Fed's statement that the labor market remained strong, economic activity increased at a moderate rate, while business investment and exports remained weak and inflation remained below the 2% target. "This statement is considered as an indication that the Fed will not aggressively reduce interest rates in the next quarter. As we predicted last week that the market already knows that the Fed will reduce interest rates for the third time, but the statement of Fed officials regarding opportunities for future interest rates will affect movement the market, "he said. This is a negative sentiment because the Fed is unlikely to be aggressive in reducing future interest rates. Brexit uncertainty is still a sentiment in the market. European Council President Donald Tusk said Britain could leave the EU at any time before January 31, provided Prime Minister Boris Johnson could obtain Brexit approval from Parliament. There is still a long way to go because the British PM has been rejected by Parliament. This prompted British Prime Minister Boris Johnson to seek approval from Parliament to hold early elections on 12 December in order to break the Brexit impasse. The non-positive Brexit negotiations became a negative sentiment in the market. Check out the video "Dollar Breaks Rp. 14,200" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (fig / fig)
